description: Describes the spatial area of the resource

_88boundingBox.description: The four sides of geodetic box defining the area of the resource

___eastLongitude.description: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

___northLatitude.description: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

___southLatitude.description: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

___minimumAltitude.description: The minimum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

___westLongitude.description: Western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

___unitsOfAltitude.description: The units of measure in which altitude is expressed.

___maximumAltitude.description: The maximum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

$eref.description:
GeoJSON is a format for encoding a variety of geographic data structures. A GeoJSON object may represent a geometry, a feature, or a collection of features. 

GeoJSON supports the following geometry types: Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString, MultiPolygon, and GeometryCollection. Features in GeoJSON contain a geometry object and additional properties, and a feature collection represents a list of features. 

 The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) [WGS84] datum, with longitude and latitude units    of decimal degrees.  This is equivalent to the coordinate reference    system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN    urn:ogc:def:crs:OGC::CRS84. 

See http://geojson.org for the full specification.
$eref.title: GeoJSON object

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers

___geometries.description: The set of geometry objects constituting the GeometryCollection.

oneOf.description: A feature object with no identified properties.
oneOf.title: null

ISO 19115-2: geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > [Point, LineString, Polygon] > description

___featureScope.description: A word or phrase identifying the type of object described by the feature.

___identifier.description: Identifier for the geographic element with optional cited authority.

___acquisitionMethod.description: Method used to establish the position of the geographic feature.

ISO 19115-2: geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > [Point, LineString, Polygon] > name

___featureName.description: A title associated with a feature.

_88featureProperties.description: JSON object containing information about a feature or collection.
_88featureProperties.title: FeatureProperties

_88feature.description: A GeoJSON object with the type "Feature" is a feature object. A feature object has a geometry, properties, and an optional identifier.
_88feature.title: Feature

oneOf.description: A feature object with no associated geometry. For example, a null value may be used when defining a bounding box only.
oneOf.title: null geometry

___geometry.description: The geometry object associated with the Feature.

___id.description: Unique identifier for the GeoJSON feature object.

_88featureCollection.description: A GeoJSON object comprised of multiple Feature objects.
_88featureCollection.title: FeatureCollection

___features.description: Set of Features constituting the FeatureCollection.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_GeographicDescription > geographicIdentifier > MD_Identifier > code

___description.description: Short description of the geographic areal domain of the data set. Examples include, "Manistee River watershed", "extent of 7 Â½ minute quads containing any property belonging to Yellowstone National Park", or "ponds and reservoirs larger than 2 acres in Jefferson County, Colorado".

$eref.description: The four sides of geodetic box defining the area of the resource

___eastLongitude.description: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

___northLatitude.description: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

___southLatitude.description: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

___minimumAltitude.description: The minimum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

___westLongitude.description: Western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

___unitsOfAltitude.description: The units of measure in which altitude is expressed.

___maximumAltitude.description: The maximum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

___boundingBox.description: General geographic position of the resource.

___geographicElement.description: An array of objects each describing a geographic boundary or location comprising all or a portion of the resource.

___containsData.description: Idication of whether the geographic element encompasses an area covered by the data or an area where data are not present.

___description.description: A natural language description of the meaning of the identifier value.

___namespace.description: A string which unambiguously defines the namespace for the identifier.

___identifier.description: A name that is used to identify the resource.

___authority.description: Citation for the authority issuing the identifier.
